conclusion: The velocity of each object is the area under its acceleration-time curve from 0 to t₁.
For object A, the region under the curve is a rectangle of height a₀ and width t₁.
The velocity of object A, v_A, is calculated as a₀ t₁.
For object B, the region under the curve is a right-triangle with base t₁ and height a₀.
The velocity of object B, v_B, is calculated as ½ a₀ t₁.
Therefore, v_A = 2 v_B, hence the velocities are unequal at t₁.
At the instant t₁, the two objects do not have the same velocity; object A is moving faster.
